summary: An internal FBI email from July 10, 2019, requesting assistance from other squads to execute a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence for digital media and computer equipment. The email notes that most of the requesting squad (C-20) is in Florida interviewing victims.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force
persons.context: The individual who forwarded the original request for search assistance to others, likely to canvass their squad for availability.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's residence
events.description: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) planned to execute a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence for digital media and computer equipment.

events.title: Request for search assistance
events.description: An email was sent requesting assistance from other FBI squads to help execute a search warrant at Epstein's residence, as most of Squad C-20 was in Florida interviewing victims.

keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) planned to execute a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence on or around July 11, 2019.
The search warrant specifically targeted digital media and computer equipment.
Most of Squad C-20 was in Florida interviewing victims at the time, necessitating a request for assistance from other squads.
The request for assistance was made via internal FBI email on July 10, 2019.
